clinical_study.brief_title: Osteoprotegerin Before and After Periodontal Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Periodontal Surgery on Osteoprotegerin Levels in Gingival Crevicular Fluid, Saliva and Gingival Tissues.

brief_summary.textblock:
The study hypothesis:
Is Osteoprotegerin a diagnostic and/or prognostic marker of periodontal disease?

detailed_description.textblock: assessment of osteoprotegerin in patients with chronic periodontitis before and after periodontal surgery in gingival crevicular fluid, saliva and gingival tissues.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Osteoprotegerin levels at 3 and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: changes from baseline in Clinical attachment level at 3 and 6 months.
Changes from baseline in probing pocket depth at 3 and 6 months
Changes from baseline in plaque index at 3 and 6 months
Changes from baseline in gingival index at 3 and 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- severe chronic periodontitis, having pocket depth of ≥ 5 mm and clinical attachment level ≥ 5 mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant women
- subjects had <22 permanent teeth
- having any given systemic disease
- taking any type of medication and/or antibiotic therapy during the 3 months before the study
- received periodontal treatment within the past 12 months
- current or former smokers.
